message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.ST, cs.IT

The paper presents a modified hierarchical beta process prior for hierarchical modeling of multiple data sources, which is a common problem in machine learning and statistics. The paper also derives a slice sampler for this model, which is a popular method for Bayesian inference. The paper then applies the model to two different data generative models, a linear Gaussian-Gaussian model for real-valued data and a linear Poisson-gamma model for count data. These applications suggest that the paper could belong to several different arXiv CS sub-categories, including cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.CV (Computer Vision), cs.ST (Statistics), and cs.IT (Information Theory). Among these, cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely categories, as the paper focuses on machine learning and Bayesian inference. The applications to text modeling and content-based image retrieval also suggest that the paper could belong to cs.CV. The use of a hierarchical factor model and the slice sampler could also be relevant to cs.ST and cs.IT.
